page.title: 19Local History-rural Sowerby
page.content: Local history is singularly lacking in this area of scattered farms which has no other buildings or ancient earthworks. Four of the farms along with their cottages form the hamlet of Thorpefield. One of these farms Thorpefield House is now known as Millburn Farm, after a farmer living there became famous for his books about farming. These are still in use today. An ancient Inn called the "Travellers Rest" on the Thirsk to Topcliffe Road has now been replaced by a Filling Station. The Old Limetree House is now Topcliffe Parks. Many old paths and green lanes are gone,as is Topcliffe Common, where the potters, tinkers and gypsies used to gather for Topcliffe Fair in its heyday.
